title: Robert O'Neill - The Man Who Killed Bin Laden
description:
Robert O’Neill is one of the most highly-decorated combat veterans of our time and the author of The New York Times best-selling memoir, "The Operator: Firing the Shots That Killed Osama bin Laden" and "My Years as a SEAL Team Warrior". O'Neill fired the headshots that killed Osama bin Laden during the raid on his Abbottabad compound on May 2, 2011.

Having trained more than 800 special operations and tactical operators, O’Neill brings this unique expertise to organizations and translates his elite SEAL team training into high-impact, actionable insights on leadership, decision-making, operating in uncertain environments, and how to become the ‘best of the best.’

He is currently a contributor at Fox News.

Since leaving active duty, O’Neill is a co-founder of Your Grateful Nation, which provides individualized transition support for Special Operations heroes and their families. They provide executive-level mentoring, transition services, and family stabilization support.
author: edwardmylett@yahoo.com (Ed Mylett)
